summary: Hong Kong should step up efforts to fight mosquitoes after the city recorded its second-longest black rainstorm warning, experts have warned, with data showing the breeding of the pest that can transmit chikungunya fever is “fairly extensive” in 70 per cent of the city’s...

A black rainstorm warning lasted 11 hours and 15 minutes on Tuesday, the second-longest on record in Hong Kong. Three days earlier, the city recorded its first imported chikungunya fever case, a mosquito-borne...
